ygData.msgSnippet: Interesting and interesting. So Tuscon s weakness is his short temper and Rodimus is his self doubt. It is not always there, but can hamper him in certain

Interesting and interesting. So Tuscon's weakness is his short temper and
R=
odimus' is his self doubt. It is not always there, but can hamper him in
ce=
rtain situations. Feel free to run with it, I will have different ones
reac=
t accordingly. There are several who could take charge should Tuscon's .
. =
. ahem . . . rage get out of hand heh heh heh >:)

I will be writing Legacy=
's response to Tuscon soon enough, as well as
everyone elses. It should be =
interesting :)

Preston

artz@...> wrote:

>

> OOC: I think it's time I slowly reveal Tucson=
's knack for having a short
> fuse as far as his temper is concerned. The s=
ituation has definitely angered
> him somewhat, and true to his bio, it wou=
ld be interesting to see how the
> preds and cons react to his seemingly cr=
itical temperament. Unlike Rodimus,
> he has a lower tolerance for nonsense=
, which has now got him to do something
> no one would ever think he'd do. =
And that's to request that Legacy be cast
> out of the Ark, ordered not to =
return. But he could also be wrong about
> Legacy, and not all beings are p=
erfect in judgement. He has given the order
> to cast him out, leaving that=
 to Stanton, Bump and Perceptor. Then again,
> his temperament could also c=
oncern his comrades a bit. After all, to them he
> is rather new, exept to =
Rodimus of course. So could Tucson Prime actually
> have a tiny bit of dark=
ness in him? Just a slight? And when he rescued
> Rodimus from darkness, co=
uld he have brought something back with him? And if
> so, being who he is, =
he tries hard to surpress what is happening to him, but
> is that working? =
Just something to throw out into the mix.
>
>

<div>Interesting and interesting. So Tuscon's weakness is his short tem=
per and Rodimus' is his self doubt. It is not always there, but can ham=
per him in certain situations. Feel free to run with it, I will have differ=
ent ones react accordingly. There are several who could take charge should =
Tuscon's . . . ahem . . . rage get out of hand heh heh heh >:)</div>=

oon enough, as well as everyone elses. It should be interesting=A0:)</div>

yle=3D"BACKGROUND-COLOR: #fff"><span>=A0</span> 
<div>
<div>
<div>
<p>OOC: =
I think it's time I slowly reveal Tucson's knack for having a short=
 fuse as far as his temper is concerned. The situation has definitely anger=
ed him somewhat, and true to his bio, it would be interesting to see how th=
e preds and cons react to his seemingly critical temperament. Unlike Rodimu=
s, he has a lower tolerance for nonsense, which has now got him to do somet=
hing no one would ever think he'd do. And that's to request that Le=
gacy be cast out of the Ark, ordered not to return. But he could also be wr=
ong about Legacy, and not all beings are perfect in judgement. He has given=
 the order to cast him out, leaving that to Stanton, Bump and Perceptor. Th=
en again, his temperament could also concern his comrades a bit. After all,=
 to them he is rather new, exept to Rodimus of course. So could Tucson Prim=
e actually have a tiny bit of darkness in him? Just a slight? And when he r=
escued Rodimus from darkness, could he have brought something back with him=
? And if so, being who he is, he tries hard to surpress what is happening t=
o him, but is that working? Just something to throw out into the mix. 
<div=
